name: Difficult More Mixed Trivia Quiz | 10 Questions | General

questions.text: Which resort area is known as the 'English Riviera'?
questions.explanation:
Torbay.

	Torbay includes the resorts of Torquay and Paignton. Torquay was the setting for 'Fawlty Towers'.

questions.text: What disease is known variously as SIDA and SLIM?
questions.explanation:
AIDS.

	SIDA is the French version of the acronym AIDS. SLIM is one of the names given to the disease in Africa.

questions.text: What kind of animal was 'Dolly', the first cloned mammal in the UK?
questions.explanation:
Sheep.

	Dolly was cloned by Scottish scientists in the late '90's, sparking an ongoing ethical debate.

questions.text: In which country is software giant SAP based?
questions.explanation:
Germany.

	Based in Walldorf, it is the 3rd largest independent software company in the world.

questions.text: Who was the Prime Minister of Israel in March 2001?
questions.explanation:
Ariel Sharon.

	Hawkish leader of the Likud party, Sharon is a former general now aged 72.

questions.text: Which African countries have experienced civil war between rival Tutsi and Hutu tribes?
questions.explanation:
Rwanda and Burundi.

	Both Rwanda and Burundi have been affected by this conflict.

questions.text: What was the model of the US spy plane captured by China after a forced landing?
questions.explanation:
EP-3.

	EP-3 is the correct answer. U2 is an earlier generation of spy plane, F-8 is the Chinese fighter plane (and UB40 is a UK welfare form!)

questions.text: Of which country was Abdurrahman Wahid the President?
questions.explanation:
Indonesia.

	Wahid was Indonesia's first democratically-elected President.

questions.text: Who was the original presenter of the TV quiz programme, the 'Weakest Link'?
questions.explanation:
Anne Robinson.

	Anne Robinson, former newspaper columnist and consumer journalist, was the original host in both the UK and US versions of the show.

questions.text: Which international cricket team is known as the 'Windies'?
questions.explanation:
West Indies & West Indian.

	Windies is simply an abbreviated version of W Indies for West Indies.
